messages: 8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:51): i wanna make a net_install_server in my solaris10,and i have made the *.iso file from solaris9 installation cd.
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:52): but when i run setup_install_server ,get the following error:
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:52): ERROR: Install boot image /mnt/v1/Solaris_9/Tools/Boot does not exist
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:52): Check that boot image exists, or use [-t] to
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:52): specify a valid boot image elsewhere.
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:53): hum...i have read the document ,but not refer to that :(
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (12:54): thats because the install media is sliced, you only have mounted one slice of it, the Tools/Boot directory is actually a simlink into another slice.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (12:55): i guess dvd's are easier to work with
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (12:56): should i mount the other slices from the iso file?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (12:56): and to complicate it further, the s0 slice is hsfs and the others are ufs format
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (12:56): well, that is the problem, you can't
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (12:56): you have to disect the iso first into its slices and make each slice its own iso
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:00): i think i put an "bad" cd in cdrom,
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:00): and it can't read out it
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (13:01): time to break out a paper clip
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:04): i have tried to start/stop vol_manage ,volcheck,fuser ....
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:06): Doc, i have tried , told me :no such file or directory
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (13:08): fuser -c  on where it's mounted
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:08): Jul  8 15:40:44 lltest  Error for Command: read(10)                Error Level: Fatal
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:08): Jul  8 15:40:44 lltest scsi: [ID 107833 kern.notice]    Requested Block: 332644                    Error Block: 332644
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:08): Jul  8 15:40:44 lltest scsi: [ID 107833 kern.notice]    Vendor: TOSHIBA                            Serial Number: 01/07/05
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:08): Jul  8 15:40:44 lltest scsi: [ID 107833 kern.notice]    Sense Key: No Additional Sense
8f63c69728b9da756d28f098c114c3f8 (13:08): Jul  8 15:40:44 lltest scsi: [ID 107833 kern.notice]    ASC: 0x0 (no additional sense info), ASCQ: 0x0, FRU: 0x0
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (13:11): stop vold, umount the filesystem (with -f if needed) then manually eject the disk
c359f9cde4c4eb3400a3e3c041b0bc53 (13:57): Hello, I've just deleted an importand directory -- how do I recover it? Thanks.
